reviewText: Jessy Dixon was my favorite Gospel singer I just sorry he left to soon he was a great Gospel singer
This man was never highlighted enough on Gaither Gospel  shows. Here is his best and will become a living legacy. I swear this man is probably singin' and shoutin' in heaven.
Jesse Dixon was a tremendous Gospel singer. I was saddened by his death a couple of years ago.  I recommend this CD.
Jessy's enthusiasm for praising the Lord is catching when you view this video - I learned something new, too.  I didn't realize he was an accomplished gospel pianist; that guy has it all!

Jessie Dixon always took me to the throne of God and showed me a peak into Heaven!!  Lots of dancing going on up there; especially since Jessie went "Home" to be with the Lord last year.  Miss him SO much!!!  If you don't have this, it's a must for gospel music fans!!
Truely a great look into the life and music that was JESSY DIXON! I have been a big fan of his for years. It is wonderful to get a different view of this man.

Jessy Dixon, a memorable gospel singer and songwriter died Sept. 26, 2011 at 73. Jessy Dixon is someone to watch, not only with his dapper and meticulous appearance, he is a smooth dancer across the stage. Bill Gaither chats with Jessy Dixon, and if you are not familiar with Jessy Dixon, take a look at these many performances, from some classic Homecoming Series Concerts. Born in Texas, Jessy Dixon had chronic asthmatic but tells how he believes God healed him and he hasn't had an attack. He lives in Chicago with many animals, including llamas. And you will hear of his travels in Europe. He played the piano with James Cleveland, sang with Mahalia, and was an influence to Paul Simon. There are some soulful rousing performances, beginning with "I Saw the Light" & "I Stood on the Banks". These songs are taken from Memphis Homecoming a memorable concert! A favorite of mine is written by Nancy Harmon, "The Blood Bought Church" from Irish Homecoming. Nancy has sang on the Gaithers before, and she does it excellent! Also, one I had not heard, I especially enjoyed the upbeat "I'm So Glad". The coming together of black and white gospel was a concert called Build a Bridge and Jessy sings "Get Away Jordan" and "Yes". A few memorable songs include one with Andrae Crouch, who wrote "Soon and Very Soon", and listen to this beautiful Rusty Goodman song, "Leavin' On My Mind", very emotional song. Plus, I love "The Wicked Shall Cease Their Troubling", "I Can't Even Walk" and "Master the Tempest is Raging". You will see a song from A Tribute to Mahalia Jackson : Lynda Randle, wonderful and intimate setting and Jesse sings "God is Standing By". Other performances include: God Be With You; Heavenly News; Lord, Give Me Wings; The Night Before Easter; I'm Rich; I'm so Glad; I Am Redeemed and from Gaither Gospel Series: Jerusalem, Moses Take Your Shoes Off. Plus, Jessy does his signature song, Sanctuary. This compilation of music by Jessy Dixon ranks high on my list of Best of Gaither Concert Series......Rizzo
I have not always been a Jessy fan and purchased this one with a little caution. However I enjoyed this a great deal and would recoment it to all..Ray
Good product and price.  Easy transaction, fast delivery.
Great DVD  Really enjoying it. You just got to love Jessy. What a talented singer and musician who was not all about himself but to lift up and worship Jesus.

I love this DVD.  I play it every morning and every night.  Bill Gaither did a great job.  I only have one complaint.  I wished he had put the entire song, "I can't even walk" instead of only the ending.
Jessy Dixon was and still is the best....great dvd
I HAVE ORDERED AND GIVEN AWAY SEVERAL OF THESE BY JESSY.  I LOVE HIS DVD AND WISH HE HAD MADE MORE BEFORE HIS DEATH  THIS WAS A GIFT TO A DEAR FRIEND.  I PLAY MY OWN A FEW TIMES A MONTH.

Did not want cd with bill gaither, wanted Jessie Dixon with Mississippi Mass choir.
fif not request this cd but stuck with it as it was a gift/
Enjoyed listening to his life story but most of all, loved the music. If you like gospel music and a fan of Jessy, this would be a good gift to yourself.
